importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: This date marks the publication of the Sunday review of Week 7 of the 2025 NFL season, highlighting key events and performances that reflect the season's volatility and dramatic outcomes.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The first seven weeks of the 2025 NFL season have seen a record number of lead changes in the final two minutes of regulation, signaling increased unpredictability in game outcomes and reinforcing the theme of dramatic comebacks and team instability.

keyTakeAways: The NFL season has shown increasing volatility with 26 lead changes in the final two minutes of regulation through Week 7 — the most in history over that span.
The Denver Broncos made history by overcoming a 19-point deficit in the fourth quarter, becoming the first team since 2007 to reverse an 18-point lead after the first three quarters.

Second-year quarterback Bo Nix led a dramatic comeback against the New York Giants, throwing for 174 yards and two touchdowns and rushing for two scores, ultimately winning on a field goal with 1 second left.

Drake Maye broke Tom Brady’s Patriots franchise record for completion percentage (88.5%) with a 91.3% completion rate in a 31-13 win over the Tennessee Titans, becoming the first player in Super Bowl era to achieve 90% completions, over 200 yards passing, and over 50 yards rushing in a single game.
Miami Dolphins’ Tua Tagovailoa was benched in the fourth quarter after throwing three interceptions in a 31-6 loss to the Cleveland Browns, with rookie Quinn Ewers taking over.
New York Jets’ Justin Fields was benched at halftime due to poor first-half performance (6-of-12, 46 yards), replaced by Tyrod Taylor who threw two interceptions.
The article underscores the rising unpredictability of NFL outcomes, with late comebacks and quarterback benchings reflecting broader trends of team instability and resilience under pressure.
Head coach Mike Vrabel, who was fired by the Titans in 2024, won his first game against the Patriots, signaling a turning point for the franchise and a shift in team dynamics.

namedEntities.name: Ben Morse
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Ben Morse is the author of the CNN article, providing a journalistic perspective on Week 7 NFL action, contributing to public awareness of the season’s dramatic developments.

namedEntities.name: CNN
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: CNN is the source of the article, ensuring credibility and broad dissemination of information about NFL events to a global audience.

namedEntities.name: Denver Broncos
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Broncos made history by overcoming a 19-point deficit in the fourth quarter, marking the first such comeback in NFL history after a 18-point lead after three quarters.

namedEntities.name: New York Giants
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Giants were defeated in a dramatic fourth-quarter comeback by the Broncos, highlighting the unpredictability of late-game NFL outcomes.

namedEntities.name: Bo Nix
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Bo Nix led a historic comeback with 16-of-25 passing and two touchdowns, and two rushing scores, making him a central figure in the Denver Broncos' dramatic win.

namedEntities.name: Marvin Mims
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Marvin Mims caught a game-winning deep pass from Bo Nix, setting up the final field goal that secured the Broncos' victory.

namedEntities.name: Courtland Sutton
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Courtland Sutton was targeted by Bo Nix in the fourth quarter and contributed to the Broncos’ scoring drive that culminated in a winning field goal.

namedEntities.name: Green Bay Packers
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Packers scored two touchdowns in the final quarter and forced a turnover to beat the Arizona Cardinals, illustrating the trend of late-game comebacks.

namedEntities.name: Arizona Cardinals
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Cardinals lost to the Packers in a dramatic finish, with backup quarterback Jacoby Brissett struggling on their final drive.

namedEntities.name: Jacoby Brissett
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Brissett, as backup quarterback, failed to complete a crucial drive in the final minutes, showing how quarterback performance can impact game outcomes.

namedEntities.name: Micah Parsons
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Parsons recorded a third sack of the game and disrupted the Cardinals’ final drive, showcasing defensive impact in close games.

namedEntities.name: Drake Maye
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Maye broke Tom Brady’s Patriots franchise record with a 91.3% completion rate, marking a pivotal moment in the team’s rebuilding phase.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Patriots’ quarterback Drake Maye delivered a historic performance, signaling a new era in franchise quarterback development.

namedEntities.name: Tennessee Titans

namedEntities.name: Tua Tagovailoa

namedEntities.name: Quinn Ewers

namedEntities.name: Miami Dolphins
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Dolphins suffered a humiliating 31-6 loss to the Browns, resulting in a coaching shake-up and Tua Tagovailoa’s benching.

namedEntities.name: New York Jets
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Jets remain winless at 0-7 after a 13-6 loss to the Panthers, with multiple quarterback changes signaling instability.

namedEntities.name: Justin Fields
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Fields struggled in the first half, leading to his benching at halftime and highlighting the challenges of quarterback performance under pressure.

namedEntities.name: Tyrod Taylor
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Taylor replaced Fields and played more effectively, though he committed two interceptions, showing mixed results in a high-stakes game.

namedEntities.name: Aaron Glenn
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Glenn made the decision to bench Fields, signaling a shift in team strategy and leadership amid offensive struggles.

namedEntities.name: Mike Vrabel
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Vrabel, who was fired by the Titans in 2024, won his first game against the Patriots, indicating a major turnaround in team dynamics and performance.

namedEntities.name: Bryce Young
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Young was injured mid-game against the Panthers and played through injury, allowing Carolina to secure their first road win of the season.

namedEntities.name: Los Angeles Rams

namedEntities.name: Kansas City Chiefs

namedEntities.name: Philadelphia Eagles

namedEntities.name: Los Angeles Chargers

namedEntities.name: Dallas Cowboys

namedEntities.name: San Francisco 49ers
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The 49ers beat the Falcons 20-10, showcasing a solid defensive and offensive effort.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Week 7 of the 2025 NFL season was defined by dramatic comebacks, record-breaking performances, and significant coaching changes. The Denver Broncos made history by overcoming a 19-point deficit in the fourth quarter, becoming the first team to reverse an 18-point lead after three quarters. Second-year quarterback Bo Nix delivered a standout performance, throwing for two touchdowns and rushing for two, culminating in a game-winning field goal. Meanwhile, Drake Maye set a new Patriots franchise record with a 91.3% completion rate, surpassing Tom Brady’s previous 88.5% mark, marking a pivotal moment in the team’s transition. On the downside, the Miami Dolphins and New York Jets both suffered major losses, resulting in quarterback benchings — Tua Tagovailoa was replaced by rookie Quinn Ewers after three interceptions, and Justin Fields was benched at halftime due to poor performance. The Jets remain winless at 0-7, raising questions about team stability. The season has seen 26 lead changes in the final two minutes — the most in NFL history — highlighting the growing unpredictability of outcomes. These events underscore both the resilience of teams in high-pressure situations and the fragility of stability in coaching and player performance.
title: Historic and dramatic comebacks, second-year QB breaks Tom Brady record and high-profile benchings: NFL Week 7 Sunday review
